alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 4:52AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: * Flash Freeze and Burst of Snowfall Late This Morning* Temperatures will rapidly drop this morning from the 40`s to the 10`s by late afternoon. With the temperature drop rain will change to a burst of moderate to perhaps heavy snowfall. A quick inch or so of snowfall is expected in spots during the 10AM to 1PM timeframe across the Southern Tier of New York into the Finger Lakes along with Pike and Wayne counties in Pennsylvania. The temperature drop coupled with snow accumulations will lead to slick and hazardous travel late this morning and lasting through the day. Delay travel or allow extra time to reach your destination with conditions becoming hazardous.
